_header: Christ that art both light and day
_description: ‘Criste qui lux es et dies’ — seven quatrains

BLHar665.First Lines: Crist þat art boþe liȝt & dayDerkenesse of niȝt þou doyst away…
BLHar665.Last Lines: …Wyth þe holy gost oone god þey þreNow & ay Amen say we
BLHar665.Note: Each stanza preceded by two-line Latin text, the first of which begins “Criste qui es lux & dies….”
BLHar665.Editions:
Robbins,  Rossell Hope. 
             “Middle English Versions of ‘Christe qui lux es’.” 
             Harvard Theological Review
         47 (1954): 55-63: 59-60.
